{"step_by_step_thinking": "To differentiate between prerenal and intrinsic kidney disease, we need to assess the urine sodium content and the fractional excretion of urea (FEUrea). The sulfosalicylic acid test is used to detect protein in the urine, and nitrates in urine are not relevant in this context.", "answer_choice": "C. Fractional excretion of urea (FEUrea)"}
